1.content:
You just got home after a long school day. It was very late at night and you were very tired. Outside your to your apartment you come across a nice young woman you had never seen before.

"Hey!" says the woman smiling at you.

You stopped, wondering who she was. You also couldn't help but notice how beautiful she was.

"How are you?" asks the woman.

"Uhh... Tired!" you reply, wondering what she wanted.

She laughs a bit at your response before saying, "Yeah, I can tell."

You feel like you are about to pass out. You collapse against the wall and she rushes over to you and helps you to your door.

"What do you want?" you ask.

She laughs again, this time nervously. "Actually I'm here to give you this," she says, handing you a small key.

"What is it?" you ask her.

"A key silly!" she says.

You finally manage to open the door to your apartment.

"Anyways see you around!" she says, heading down the hallway.

You stand there confused as to what is going on until she gets into the elevator.

You then enter your apartment and spot, sitting on your kitchen table, a large cardboard box with a shipping label on it. You go over to the box and look at the label. Based on the label it says it is for you. Shrugging your shoulders you pick up the box and take it to the couch. There you open it to find a large wooden jewelry box inside. You decide you've had enough oddities for now so you put the key the woman gave you on top of the box and go to bed.

The next morning you wake up to find that you'd accidentally left the door open. You close the door and go sit down on the couch. There you see the jewelry box again. Figuring you might as well see what it is all about you use the key to unlock it and open the box. The first thing you find is a note that says that all you need to do is put on a piece of jewelry and you'll get to experience someone else's life. You then look to see that the jewelry box is a...
1.title: The Finding of The Box

121322.content:
Still in shock over your sudden transformation, you don't make the connection from putting on the ring. As such you decide trying to not bring attention to yourself is the best option. You quickly sit down at the desk and furiously read through the teacher's plan. At the top, you discover your new bodies name: May Sella. It then becomes apparent her next class is a group of sophomores who are currently reading Great Expectations.

"Perfect! I read that one when I was in high school."

You look over her plans for the class that day and soon feel reasonably comfortable that you can get through this. Students are already sitting at their seats chattering about various topics. Soon the bell rings and a few more rush into the room and quickly sit down. The talk has died down and most of the students are looking at you expectantly. Here we go, you think and proceed to lead a halfway decent conversation on the characterization of Pip. You soon lose yourself a bit in your role and begin walking around the room and pointing to various students. It is a bit awkward not knowing anyone's name. So you covertly move back to your desk and pull out a seating chart that you can use.

Everything is going great until twenty minutes before the class ends. You notice out of the corner of your eye a boy sitting in the corner who is clearly checking you out. When everyone else is either looking at their books or whoever is currently speaking, his eyes are drifting mostly to the back of your skirt. This makes you incredibly self conscious the more you think about it and you start to fidget uncomfortably. Looking at the clock, you go off the plan and tell your students to break off into small groups and write reflections on the most recent chapter they read. Then you sit back at your desk exhausted by the performance and answer a few stray questions about formatting for the reflection. The brown haired student who was looking at you has got to work with his group which relieves you quite a bit. After a few more minutes the bell rings again.

"Make sure everyone's name is on the paper, and remember to read the next chapter before class!" You call out as everyone begins to mill about.

You are a bit surprised that you came out with that so casually. Soon most of the students are gone with a few saying "Good bye Ms. Sella!" hmm, sounds like she's not married you think to yourself.

Your first statement boomed our around the room. A number of councillors looked rather shocked at your proclamation but only a few looked displeased.

"After careful review I have decided to recommend in favour of maintaining the building's protected status. After all, a building such as this cannot be replaced once lost and I believe that this is a building that we must take actions to preserve. While I'm sure that some would like to see more condos, along with the taxpayers and voters they would bring, the old foundry is far too important to destroy."

You pause for a moment to gauge the reaction to your reversal of the real Elizabeth's decision.

"In fact I think that it is imperative that we look into ways to make use of the building so that it may be protected for the future. Possibly converting it for use as an indoor market or museum. Overall and in conclusion the historical protection status should be preserved and that is my recommendation!" you conclude.

There is a long pause. It almost seems like people were more surprised by your brevity than by what you said.

"Interesting!" announced the same man you call you to the floor, "And as everyone knows, we all voted to ratify Councillor Bohmler's recommendation. In that case I'd like to proclaim that the foundry's protected status is preserved and move that at our next session we form a committee to review what to do with the foundry now that redevelopment is out of the picture."

You smile nervously.

14431.content:
You pick out a pair of bronze hoop earrings. You don't usally wear stuff like this but... What the heck. It could be good for a laugh. You get up and take a good look in the bathroom mirror, holding the earrings up to your ears. Now, that doesn't look half bad. Maybe you could use them for a Halloween costume or someth- Suddenly, your perspective shifts drastically. You are sitting on a soft carpet. A thick cloud of smoke blocks your vision and you can hear laughter all around you. And is that... Jefferson Airplane?

AH! You are back in your bathroom. What the heck was that? Was that the... The earrings? Um... There's only one way to know...
You put the earrings on. Where do you go?
14431.title: The Hoop earrings.

144311.content:
You cough. "Whoa there, sister! Is that too much for ya?" More laughing. Where are you? What is going on? "Hey Lyd! If you can't take it, pass it!" You are holding something. A smoking something. You blindly hand it to the voice. You wave a hand in the smoke that's in front of you. There is an arm around your shoulder. A soft, slender arm. A woman's arm. "Give the kid a break, Marko. She's new." That voice is right next to you. What the... Your vision starts to clear up. You are in a room. A very smoky room. There are pillows all over the place. You are surrounded by a bunch of people. They are dressed very strangely... Like... Hippies? Long hair, round glasses and psychadelic patterns. Whaaaaat...?

"Hey Lyd, you wanna get out of here?" Who said that? Are they talking to you? "Lyd? You alright babe?" You look to your right. The questioning voice belongs to the owner of the arm that lies around your shoulder. And dang man. It's a girl. A very pretty girl. A red-headed girl. Her hair is long and there are freckles all over her face. She has a Scottish accent. You should probably say something. "Yeah, I'm fine." You say.

Now what?
144311.title: Welcome to the Summer of Love, man!

14432.content: A huge embellished Sapphire, with silver and gold trim. It's woven into a powerful lion's mouth, the eyes are also sapphires. It has an imposing presence, almost a royal aura stairs about it or an overwhelming one. The side next to it are bracelets, with the same amount of decor, carefully carved with old runic symbols. Your thinking of Vikings, but they have an angelic quality to them, a very poised and ordered form, almost divine really.
14432.title: More jewelry choices

info.brief_description: You find a jewelry box that when you put on some jewelry you are put into someone's body
info.description:
Your name is Larry Hedley. You are 21, attending university studying history, and live on your own in an apartment near campus. You don't really have very many good friends. One day you wind up finding a jewelry box full of magic jewelry. What the jewelry does is to transfer you into the body of someone else. You are free to return by simply removing the jewelry you put on in the first place. However, if anyone else ever removes it from your new body first, you will be stuck in the new body forever.

Per initial storyline there will only be one of the following jewelry boxes available: (Each box only can put you into a particular category of new body and some may even have other rules)
Bridal jewelry: First time you put something on is morning of the woman you'll be swapping into's wedding. (In the case of rings, you will only be able to remove them and swap back after the wedding ceremony)
Professional jewelry: You swap into an adult who is working
Student Jewelry: You swap into either a highschool or university student
Historical jewelry: You swap into women from across history

Basic Rules:
1. Don't kill off the main character or end the story
2. keep long lists of options going
3. no one option chapters
4. only 1 jewelry box per story
5. No memory swap or personality changes. The only mental change is Larry knows whatever languages the person whose body he is in knows and has their writing style.
6. Please add and Have Fun
